programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers attend a locker auction in Orange County, where Ivy Calvin ends up having to dig through a pile of rubbish.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An autographed picture of John Belushi and a Jim Henson puppet arrive in the shop, but it remains to be seen if any of them are worth big money.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A rare Nepalese Bira gun from the late 1800s arrives in the shop, and a 1970s Bob Peak TWA mural makes a big impression.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Staff at the Detroit family pawn shop encounter a gynaecologist's table and an elephant's skull.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les challenges Seth to a high-stakes sales competition, but later faces the most dangerous customer he has ever encountered.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick and the team repair a 1960s popcorn machine, and a client brings in an antique air compressor.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: While Rick is away, his brother Ron takes matters into his own hands when a client brings in a 1900s love tester. Is this a match made in overhaul heaven?.

programme.title: Search for the Lost Giants
programme.sub-title: A Photo a Tooth the Truth?
programme.desc: Two potentially game-changing discoveries are made in the Ozarks as the investigation into whether giant humanoids ever roamed America continues.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: The 1979 investigation into the abduction and murder of an eight-year-old boy in Gary, Indiana, as police struggled to understand why anyone would want an innocent child dead.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: A famous cowboy offers his assistance to the bidders at an auction in Fort Worth, while Lesa finds a means to triumph over her rival.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: One of the buyers accidentally acquires a historically important item, while Victor gets his hands on an intriguing locked treasure chest - with no key.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Hordes of angry customers face hour-long queues, Les tries to work out whether a dealer is selling stolen goods, and a feud erupts between Seth and Andy.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth struggles with a negotiation on an exceptionally busy day, and Ashley tries to find a customer's missing guitar.

programme.title: Search for the Lost Giants
programme.desc: Jim and Bill Vieira track promising leads on the Goshen Mystery Tunnel site, and a giant skeleton found in 1849.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: Area 51 is considered the ultimate top secret facility, but there is another military site, known as Area 52, where strange phenomena have been witnessed for 10 years.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Places on Earth where aliens may have landed in ancient times, from Mexico's Zone of Silence to the Markawasi Plateau in Peru.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick and the team restore a 1920s radio and make a deal to repair an ice-cream seller's bicycle from the 1940s.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick and his son compete to see who can restore a vintage scooter the fastest, while the team fixes a vending machine.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A hand-painted, signed guitar from Def Leppard's Phil Collen rocks into the shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A signed platinum disc from glam metal band Poison has Rick wondering whether it is worth adding to his record collection.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi and Jarrod realise they will have to pool their resources with Barry if they are to stand any chance of making a profit at an auction in San Jacinto.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers return to Montebello, where Darrell made the most profitable purchase in the show's history.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders consider the benefits and drawbacks of two very different neighbourhoods, and Lesa displays her ruthless side while dealing with a young buyer.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: A piano, a tea set and some expensive furniture are among the finds up for grabs when the buyers go to Lewisville, Texas.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Former winners return for the chance to craft a weapon known for its unique mechanics and deadly double-edged blade - the pata.

programme.title: Search for the Lost Giants
programme.desc: Brothers Jim and Bill Vieira investigate accounts of giant skeletons being found across America, to determine if these stories are true and who the bones belonged to.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The team investigates growing numbers of flying orbs sightings, with witnesses also experiencing odd dreams, premonitions and deep fear.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The theory that aliens might have told Joan of Arc how to beat the English army, and whether an American serviceman received a message when he touched a spaceship.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds' reputation is at stake when a customer claims he was sold a fake watch, and Ashley makes a large offer for some gemstones.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les has to call security when an argument over a missing item turns violent, a high-stakes gambler visits the shop for funds and a customer tries to sell a gynaecologist's table.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi attends an auction without Jarrod, who has no idea what she intends to spend their money on. Darrell finds a kit that could brew him a nice profit.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi try to get the better of some inexperienced new faces on the auction circuit, while Barry attends a sale in Inglewood.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A Roman coin from 44 BC featuring Julius Caesar's portrait is brought into the shop, but it remains to be seen whether the owner will command a high price.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys head down to the shooting range to try out a pair of Duck's Foot pistols, where Chum sets out to prove he is a crack shot.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The 80s have taken over as the Pawn Stars look back at some of their favourite items..

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Pawn Stars revisit some of the most wicked items to ever come in the shop: a thermonuclear weapon warhead cover, a desk with a dark secret, and a collection of knives..

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi and Jarrod realise they will have to pool their resources with Barry if they are to stand any chance of making a profit at an auction in San Jacinto.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers return to Montebello, where Darrell made the most profitable purchase in the show's history.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions on the topic of liars and lying. Joining regular panellist Alan Davies are comedienne Sara Pascoe, Bad Education and Fresh Meat star Jack Whitehall, and stand-up and The Last Leg host Adam Hills.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Comedy quiz show, hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on events in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians James Acaster, Tom Allen, Ed Byrne, Kerry Godliman and Tez Ilyas. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other. First shown in July 2018.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy panel quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions on the topic of ladies and gents. Joining regular panellist Alan Davies are stand-up comedian Ross Noble, Australian author Kathy Lette and comedienne and Great British Bake Off presenter Sue Perkins.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions on the topic of liars and lying. Joining regular panellist Alan Davies are comedienne Sara Pascoe, Bad Education and Fresh Meat star Jack Whitehall, and stand-up and The Last Leg host Adam Hills.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Nish Kumar, Clara Amfo, Anneka Rice and Al Murray continue to test their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Comedy quiz show, hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on events in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians James Acaster, Tom Allen, Ed Byrne, Kerry Godliman and Tez Ilyas. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other. First shown in July 2018.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of the Staffordshire Police force, reflecting the daily challenges of combating crime and revealing fresh insights into modern policing.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank find a classic 33 Ford that has been sitting so long that a tree has grown around it, but nothing stops the guys from rescuing this rare ride.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Jesse starts a bidding war on a unit without knowing what is inside, while a flock of birds keeps the auction-goers interested.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Scott hope to strike it lucky as they compete for ten-pin bowling equipment.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: When they uncover one of the rarest motorcycles in the world, Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz must muster more cash than ever to seal the deal.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank visit a collection of steam engines and a house full of clocks, and also find a car for Danielle.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Steve commits to the original build time to deliver the Villain Rat Rod in three weeks. With no sign of a transmission, it doesn't look like the crew will meet their deadline.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May build their own versions of motorhomes and set off for a bank holiday weekend in the West Country to try out their creations in the real world. The Audi R8 V10 Spyder also takes on the Porsche 911 Turbo Cabriolet on the test track, and American actor Andy Garcia does a lap in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Halloween weekend sees the squad called to investigate a hair-raising skirmish at a nightclub. Documentary series following the work of the Staffordshire Police force.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: When Steve is commissioned to build a spooky car, he digs up a haunted '55 Chevy, and Justin and Travis battle to modify it. Steve and Merlon flip a Depression-era Plymouth.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond tests Volkswagen's Touareg off-roader, before driving a racing version of the car against a group of snowmobile riders in Sweden. James May tries to drive faster than he has ever done before in the Bugatti Veyron Super Sport, Jeremy Clarkson examines the legacy of Formula One driver Ayrton Senna, and Tom Cruise and Cameron Diaz are the Stars in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters hit the road in a Jensen-Healey, a Lotus and a TVR as they chart the decline of the British sports car industry, on a journey from Norfolk to Blackpool. On the test track, Jeremy Clarkson enthuses about the Ferrari 458 Italia, and actor Jeff Goldblum is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sally Phillips, Ross Noble and Nish Kumar join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig for an extended version of the comedy quiz show. This time, the topic is 'Odorous and Odious'. During the course of the show, the panellists learn why the world's second-smelliest man is so frustrated. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window, as the fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Comedians Al Murray and Nish Kumar, presenter Anneka Rice and Radio 1 DJ Clara Amfo continue the daily test of their general knowledge skills, hosted by Richard Osman.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Olympic long jump champion Greg Rutherford, broadcaster Kirsty Young, actress-writer Joanna Scanlan and comedian Henning Wehn join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the panel show, trying to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon hosts.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Funnyman Jimmy Carr, actor and comedian Griff Rhys Jones, Hairy Biker Dave Myers and news presenter Susanna Reid join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the panel show, trying to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon hosts.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Adam Hills, Jamali Maddox, Michelle Wolf
programme.desc: Adam Hills, host of Channel 4's The Last Leg, is the latest master of ceremonies at London's Hammersmith Apollo. He introduces US comic Michelle Wolf and sharp-witted Jamali Maddix to the stage.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: The competitive nature of Taskmaster bubbles alarmingly to the surface as a simple team task involving a hammock exposes tensions between two of the five comics vying to win.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he lumps together a whole host of topics, from lava lamps to love handles. Joining regular panellist Alan Davies are comedy writer and actor David Mitchell, impressionist Ronni Ancona and stand-up Jimmy Carr.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended version. Star Wars actress Carrie Fisher and comedians Bill Bailey and Jimmy Carr join regular panellist Alan Davies for a festive edition of the comedy quiz. Host Stephen Fry asks them a range of unusual questions on topics related to Christmas, with points being awarded for interesting answers as well as correct ones.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The world's most impressive disused railway bridges, including the biggest wooden trestle bridge in the world, which was closed down due to hurricane damage.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How, in 1940, the French Army suffered a heavy defeat after underestimating the Nazis' strength while relying on First World War strategies and equipment to defend its frontiers. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Shanghai Tower, which at a height of 632 metres is the second tallest building in the world, With a weight of 850,000 tons, it has been built to withstand winds of typhoon proportions.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Full Steam Ahead
programme.desc: The historians take a trip on the Flying Scotsman, arguably the most famous locomotive in the world, along its original route connecting London and Edinburgh - the two most important financial capitals of the Empire. Peter Ginn explores how the railways revolutionised the delivery of mail across Britain, he and Alex Langlands learn about the first electronic communication service - more than 100 years before the arrival of email - and Ruth finds out about the role of the wheeltapper. Plus, why do some railway clocks have more than one minute hand?.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of Kansai International Airport upon the largest man-made island in the world, in Osaka Bay, Japan. Pioneering innovators from the past such as Pierre Danel, who developed a system against the pounding sea, and 19th-century mechanic Richard Dudgeon made the project possible. The development of airports including Berlin's Tempelhof Airport and London's Croydon Airport are also explored to reveal how engineers attempted this feat of engineering..

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The world's most impressive disused railway bridges, including the biggest wooden trestle bridge in the world, which was closed down due to hurricane damage.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The drop in morale of Churchill's forces following the fall of France to Nazi forces during the Second World War, and how the Dunkirk evacuation and the Battle of Britain helped to restore British confidence. Plus, America's reasons for initially refusing to enter the conflict.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to France to explore the possibility that Jesus married Mary Magdalene, and they had children. He meets respected scholars, authors and historians to consider the theory the son of God's bloodline lives on today.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of Kansai International Airport upon the largest man-made island in the world, in Osaka Bay, Japan. Pioneering innovators from the past such as Pierre Danel, who developed a system against the pounding sea, and 19th-century mechanic Richard Dudgeon made the project possible. The development of airports including Berlin's Tempelhof Airport and London's Croydon Airport are also explored to reveal how engineers attempted this feat of engineering..

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: Nazi Occupation - Channel Islands
programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to Guernsey and Jersey to tell the story of the islands' surrender to the Nazis during the Second World War. In Guernsey, he hears of the first bombing raid that heralded the German troops' arrival and sees the spot where the first-ever British commando landed in secret, only to see the planned revenge raid fail spectacularly. A ferry then takes him on to Jersey, where he finds almost all of its beaches have a bunker or a machine gun post left over from the conflict.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to Sardinia to meet the scientists and archaeologists who have evidence that suggests giants once existed. Researchers have discovered abnormally large human skeletons in networks of elaborate caves, mines and tombs in Sardinia, China, the United States, northern India and South America. However, if the race did exist, it remains unclear as to why it has seemingly been eradicated from history.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Marine life at the poles, where winter temperatures frequently fall to a numbing -40C. Even when the sun reappears in the spring, its weak rays take a long time to melt the ice. David Attenborough describes how wildlife including seals, whales, polar bears and penguins overcome the elements to survive through prolonged cold spells.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Zak and Alex face a four-day mission to deliver a pair of classic steam locomotives for an Autumn Steam Gala at the Mid Hants Railway in Hampshire.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The world's most impressive disused railway bridges, including the biggest wooden trestle bridge in the world, which was closed down due to hurricane damage.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The drop in morale of Churchill's forces following the fall of France to Nazi forces during the Second World War, and how the Dunkirk evacuation and the Battle of Britain helped to restore British confidence. Plus, America's reasons for initially refusing to enter the conflict.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Heavy haulage experts Ian Bagladi and Jamie Turnbull need to move a classical but abandoned 63-year-old, 70-tonne locomotive, through the English countryside.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring ship graveyards, including Scapa Flow in Orkney, where German warships were scuttled after the First World War, and Mallows Bay, home to 200 wrecks colonised by wildlife.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A rare 1980s Sierra Cosworth draws in a crowd of admiring Ford fans, while a restorer delights buyers with his immaculate 1966 Sunbeam Rapier and Sarah takes a shine to a caravan.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Documentary following the exploits of a family-run crew of heavy-haulage specialists as they transport the heaviest, longest and most precious locomotives around the world. Terry and Jason have been called in to move legendary steam locomotive Britannia. The 68-year-old vehicle has undergone a major restoration in Crewe and is scheduled to start running at the Severn Valley Railway.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of three preserved steam railway lines - the South Devon Railway heritage line, the Ffestiniog and Welsh Highlands Railway and the Great Central Railway. Sports scientist Megan Smith has a dream of tending the fire of a steam locomotive on the Ffestiniog & Welsh Highland Railway, and she stokes the bolier of NG143 and sets off along the 25 miles from Caernarfon to Porthmadog.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Heavy haulage experts Ian Bagladi and Jamie Turnbull need to move a classical but abandoned 63-year-old, 70-tonne locomotive, through the English countryside.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: The discovery of a charred corpse in a disused railway tunnel sets Taggart on the gruesome hunt for a ruthless killer in an investigation with sinister undertones of black magic and voodoo. In an another twist, the wife of an arthritic dentist narrowly escapes a series of murder attempts, adding to a complex case for Taggart and his team. Starring Mark McManus, Blythe Duff and James MacPherson, and featuring a guest appearance by Annette Crosbie.

credits.actor: featuring a guest appearance by Annette Crosbie

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Beatrice leaves Jack and moves in with Evie, while the General Strike threatens the future of the new collection. Starring Stella Gonet.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the stunning Rowden Gardens on Dartmoor - one of the participants in the National Gardens Scheme.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The successful spring collection brings a surprise proposal for the future that threatens the sisters' partnership.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: New recruit Andy Butcher is overjoyed to be going on a live-firing exercise almost straight away, but soon makes a devastating mistake. As Marsha's troubles deepen, she finds solace in a bottle and spurns all offers of help from her friends, while Williams and Phillips' relationship reaches a turning point.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. After Kerry tragically loses her fight for life, Gabriel sets about covering his tracks by disposing of forensic evidence and intimidating a witness - but a shocking revelation could shatter his cold-blooded demeanour. Stunned by Kerry's death, a grief-crazed Smithy lashes out at Adam, swears revenge on David Radford and hands in his resignation to Gina, while DI Morrell resolves to track down the real culprit.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Ric confesses to Zubin that he has been gambling again, and asks him not to tell Jess - leaving the conflicted anaesthetist more convinced than ever that the relationship can never work and that he should make a fresh start in France. Back in Holby, Rosie tells Mubbs she is considering IVF treatment, while Carlos arranges for Tricia to receive private treatment for her lump - but the condition proves worse than previously thought.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Consultant Jack Hathaway begins his first shift in talkative mood, but soon infuriates Baz by going over her head to perform a risky operation normally only undertaken by neurosurgeons. He responds by telling her he expects her support and will not tolerate anger and bitterness. Elsewhere, Matt loses his temper with an awkward man in reception and Charlie finds himself obliged to report the incident.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Already grief-stricken over Kerry's death, Yvonne faces further trauma as her sister Beverley is roughed up and Shirley reappears in Sun Hill, bringing serious trouble in her wake. Andrea fears her true identity is about to be exposed when her editor is brought in for questioning, while Samantha puzzles over a cryptic message she believes was left by Abi's abductor.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil plans the perfect date, but is his idea of a romantic evening the same as Anne's? Gill gives Mark some advice about Arthur.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil is teased about his new romance and gets a surprise from Anne. Rachel tells Michelle what is worrying her.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Tate suffers a breakdown under the pressures of the job, and Charisma decides that he wants to finish his relationship with Donna.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish antiques expert stumbles on what seems to be a bargain in Frankie's scrap yard in the shape of an iron cannon. Though convinced his luck must finally have changed, problems lie ahead when the item attracts the attention of a devious major. Tongue-in-cheek drama, with Ian McShane and guest star Leslie Phillips.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim is called to investigate an incident at an international rock star's yacht that has left a heavily indebted businessman dead and his wife in a coma. Detective drama set in Jersey, starring John Nettles.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Nellie, newly released from hospital, meets the family at the Victorian mansion for their holiday - but things aren't exactly relaxing.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Grace Brothers decides to start an in-house magazine with Mr Humphries as the editor, but the new publication causes rifts among members of the staff. Vintage comedy, starring John Inman, Mollie Sugden and Wendy Richard.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: A chance encounter leads to an invitation for Jean to stay at her sister-in-law's home, but she has to persuade Lionel to accompany her. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Things to Do When Your Wife Runs Off with a Turkish Waiter
programme.desc: Barry and Glenda get a shock when a man they foolishly exchanged addresses with on holiday turns up on their doorstep. To make a strained situation worse, it appears their guest has an unusual hobby.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: Ellen Mallam is left to drown in an upturned car by its driver, but the young woman's connection to James Blackstone, an aristocratic family's heir apparent, impedes Gently and Bacchus's investigation. The chief inspector discovers that the son's future has been carefully mapped out since birth by his implacable mother Alethea, and she will not countenance any interference in her plans. However, an astonishing twist causes the detectives to reconsider the case in its entirety. Sixties-set detective drama, starring Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby, with Geraldine Somerville, James Norton, Roger Lloyd Pack, Christopher Fairbank and Ebony Buckle.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: An elderly amateur sleuth who was a friend of Danny's is murdered, and he ends up embroiled in the case when his photo is found at the scene. However, the cold case copper becomes convinced that the secret to uncovering her real killer lies within the last case she was working on. Picking up where she left off, he travels to the village of Minchampton, where a woman was said to have been murdered by a local lad 25 years previously. Meanwhile, Sasha is left to cope with the investigating officer on the modern-day Miss Marple's murder - an overbearing contemporary from her Hendon training, by the name of DCI Grace Mackie - and Steve lets Gerry stay with him when he is evicted, but soon comes to regret the act of kindness.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A woman shoots her unfaithful husband and it appears to be an open-and-shut case - until the team discovers the man was already dead. Mark McManus stars.

programme.title: Sky News at Six
programme.desc: A full round-up of the day's main events at home and abroad. Plus, live interviews, sporting headlines and weather reports.

programme.title: Sky News at 10
programme.desc: A round-up of the stories that have hit the headlines today, with Anna Botting.

programme.title: Sky News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's leading stories with Anna Botting.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.desc: Timothy West joins the host to look back on a five-decade career as one of Britain's best-loved actors. The former EastEnders star speaks candidly about his 52-year marriage to Fawlty Towers actress Prunella Scales, and the impact of her battle with dementia on their lives. He also reveals the trauma of his first wife's mental health problems, and how he finally made peace with his daughter after several years of estrangement. On a lighter note, Timothy also reflects on his role at the wedding of Prince Charles and Camilla Parker-Bowles, and the time he toured the set of Coronation Street - disguised as former Soviet president Mikhail Gorbachev.

programme.title: The Home Game
programme.desc: Homeowners compete to make the biggest profit from a major renovation, while interior design expert Linda Barker monitors their progress and appraises the end results. In the first edition, a Surrey kitchen diner sees some extravagant touches blow the budget, a father and daughter plan a high-cost low-maintenance garden makeover in Essex and a thrifty upcycler creates an amazing bedroom makeover in Kent.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and entertainment. Actress Kacey Ainsworth, who played Little Mo in EastEnders, talks about the new series of ITV's Grantchester and what is in store for her and Robson Green's character Geordie.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: The women put the world to rights once more, discussing everything from politics to parenting, and invite a celebrity guest to chat about what they are up to - or anything else that takes their fancy.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and the team value antiques in Llangollen, Denbighshire. Fay Rutter tries to make a deal over a milking stool and Simon Schneider gets hot under the collar over a saucy movie poster.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five contestants calling themselves 'The Rowley Polys' answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Traci, Sharon, Rodney and Jamie pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser. Answering general knowledge questions, they each add as much money as they dare to the jackpot - but anyone caught by the Chaser is out for good, leaving fewer players to team up and play in the final chase.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Long-running soap following the ups and downs of village life amid the rolling scenery of the Yorkshire Dales.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's headlines from a Scottish perspective, plus local news from Aberdeen, Edinburgh and Glasgow.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Long-running soap following the ups and downs of village life amid the rolling scenery of the Yorkshire Dales.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: Tech Abuse: Stopping the Stalkers - Tonight
programme.desc: Julie Etchingham explores the growing issue of 'cyber-stalking'. She asks what can be done to prevent technology being used in this way and talks to cycer-crime experts to find out how easy it is for an abuser to take control of their partner's technology.

programme.title: Welcome to HMP Belmarsh with Ross Kemp
programme.desc: The documentary maker goes inside the walls of HMP Belmarsh, the country's most notorious maximum-security jail, which has housed the country's most dangerous - and infamous - convicts, including Ian Huntley, Ronnie Biggs and Charles Bronson. Ross explores how staff cope with high-profile inmates, extremists and common criminals living side-by-side and goes inside the High Security Unit, where he meets Muhammad Asif Hafeez, known as Sultan, the alleged mastermind of a drug-smuggling empire.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo's latest leg begins in the Italian fashion capital of Milan, where he visits an elegant cocktail bar who were the first to introduce the idea of the aperitivo in the city. Its train station is one of the busiest in Europe and it's from here he travels on to the town of Treviglio, the home of Bianchi bikes - the first mass-manufactured bicycle in the world. Gino gets a tour of the factory before test riding one of their latest electric bikes alongside a group of local cyclists. Moving on, he visits the medieval town of Bergamo, where he meets ice-cream maker Niccolo, and visits a co-operative restaurant.

programme.title: Holiday Horrors: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Another selection of clips showcasing what can go wrong on holiday, including an unexpected visitor to a couple's tent on their safari holiday, footage from a GoPro camera lost at sea, and a man who took a flight to the edge of space.

programme.desc: Match highlights of all the action from the Carabao Cup.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys a Ford Mustang Fastback and gives it to mechanic Edd China to restore, as the duo hope to turn the wreck into a machine worth more than 20,000

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini has 48 hours to make a deal on a 1972 Ferrari Daytona Spyder.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini takes a 1934 MG ND Magnette with a six cylinder engine to the Scottsdale Auction.

programme.title: Chaos Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: Icy Impact, Flash Flood, Deadly Deer
programme.desc: Footage of more tales of human endurance, including a disaster caused by a flash flood.

programme.title: Chaos Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: Invading Inferno, Gutsy Granny, Ambush Avalanche
programme.desc: More daunting footage illustrates the devastating impact of fire, and an elderly woman demonstrates remarkable levels of courage.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Argentinean firefighters battle explosions during a chemical blaze, a helicopter crashes at a Spanish air show and a landslide destroys a pit mine in Malaysia.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Sydney Airport is closed after a fire and explosion, a woman survives a tornado destroying her home and a $1million boat disintegrates after hitting a wall. Presented by Ron Pitts.

programme.title: American Loggers
programme.desc: The wet fall season cripples production, and just when things cannot seem to get worse, a crane operator's rig falls through a dilapidated bridge.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: Chip Foose and the team work on a 1972 Cutlass which has been brought out of storage to be repaired.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: Agents search for a nurse whose car has been found abandoned, and suspect one of her neighbours may have been involved in her disappearance.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Three murder investigations involving poison, including arsenic and potassium chloride - one of which requires toxicology tests on frozen tissue from the victim.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: An in-depth look at a murderer who seemingly paralleled the fictional character Patrick Bateman in American Psycho, hiding behind designer clothing and expensive sunglasses.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of 24-year-old Megan Sharpton, who was raped and murdered before her body was set alight in July 2012. The torment led to her mother committing suicide.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The story of the Agofsky brothers, who abducted a banker from his home and forced him to open the vault at his workplace before throwing him off a bridge. It took the FBI five years to gather enough evidence to convict them.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: Rottweilers are seized following a fatal attack on their neighbour's dog and guinea pigs, and the team tries to rescue a kitten trapped in a carcass-strewn junkyard.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A desperate owner hopes Lisa can save a cat that has been hit by a car, and Chris battles to save Homer the turtle after a vicious dog bite.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown experiences a difficult week as he treats everything from horses, wombats, monkeys and a mother in trouble.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride looks for a dress that both she and her grandmother are happy with, while another customer wants to pay tribute to her own late grandmother with her gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Tanya takes her family with her to find a blush-coloured dress, but when they prove brutally honest in their opinions, it is left to the assistant to keep the peace.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Marie wants to please her mother and brother, but her indecision mixes with their strong opinions, while Jamie leaves her dress decision to the toss of a coin.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr Kate investigates why a rabbit has stopped eating. Plus, a sausage dog receives experimental treatment and Dr Peter helps a monkey with suspected tuberculosis.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Houston SPCA officers rescue a seriously underweight young mare from cruelty.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigators recall their work in the aftermath of Hurricane Rita, when the Houston SPCA launched one of the biggest animal rescue operations America has seen.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades selects items ripe for restoration, hoping he, Mark Haig and Kev Paxton can reinvent an old wicker table and chair, paraffin lamps and a firepit.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Officers find themselves having to reassemble a computer disk cut up with pinking shears in order to solve a brutal murder case.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Tiny pieces of plastic - the size of grains of sand - provide police with clues after a bombing in which a man was killed.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 25 year-old college graduate Mitrice Richardson, whose semi-decomposed body was found close by a marijuana farm in the Santa Monica mountains in August 2010, a year after she had been reported missing.

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
programme.desc: Jeremy Dein and Sasha Wass scrutinise the case of John Dickman, who, after being convicted of murder in 1910, became the last man to be hanged at Newcastle Prison.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A woman's sorority sisters surprise her with a weekend trip, but there is something fishy about their appointment. Bride-to-be Lauren tries to please her aunt.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Camille brings along her mother-in-law, in the hope of improving their relationship. Plus, consultant Keasha helps her friend to find the perfect dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: New consultant Carmel receives a tall order from her first customer of the day, while another woman wants to spend $2,000 on an elaborate red dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A woman refuses to stay within her budget while shopping for a dress, while Dorianne's father becomes emotional during her fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride-to-be who has planned a fairy-themed wedding hopes to find a dress to match. Plus, Vicki returns for a fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: All brides have a tight budget, forcing some to haggle for even more bang for their buck. It remains to be seen whether everyone will be able to secure their dream dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Consultant Sarah becomes engaged and looks for a dress of her own, while Sola searches for a gown that will reflect her culture.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Carmel is assigned to help a bride-to-be who is preparing a military wedding, but Randy steps in instead. Plus, a client searches for a dress to renew her vows in.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a Kent antiques emporium specialising in unusual European antiques, and indulges in 1940s nostalgia at a home-front museum in south-west Wales.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades selects items ripe for restoration, hoping he, Mark Haig and Kev Paxton can reinvent an old wicker table and chair, paraffin lamps and a firepit.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. Since his mother died, Aaron has had to support his father. However, he struggles with food addiction and must care for himself to avoid eating himself to an early grave.

programme.title: The Killer in My Family
programme.desc: The relatives of murderers tell their stories, beginning with Fred West, whose brother Doug and niece Sam reveal how his crimes affected the family.

programme.title: The Detectives: My Killer Case
programme.desc: Disturbing crimes from across the UK are unpacked and retold in intimate detail through police files, CCTV footage and accounts from those who helped solve them.

programme.title: 10 Steps to Murder
programme.desc: A venerable young man, allowed to live independently for the first time, is murdered in cold blood at the hands of a couple playing a truly warped game of deceit and lies.
